events.description: Experience traditional Hatsumode (first shrine visit of the year) at Kyoto's major shrines, with special New Year food and decorations throughout the city.

featuredEvents.name: Toka Ebisu Festival
featuredEvents.description: A lively festival dedicated to Ebisu, the god of business prosperity and wealth.

featuredEvents.name: Hatsumode
featuredEvents.description: First shrine visit of the year, with special blessings and fortunes.

events.description: Join the festivities as temples across Kyoto hold Setsubun ceremonies to drive away evil spirits and welcome good fortune.

featuredEvents.name: Setsubun at Yoshida Shrine
featuredEvents.description: One of the most famous Setsubun celebrations featuring demon-masked performers.

featuredEvents.name: Plum Blossom Viewing
featuredEvents.description: Early spring flower viewing of beautiful plum blossoms.

events.description: Explore Kyoto's historic Higashiyama district illuminated by thousands of lanterns, with special light displays at temples and along streets.

featuredEvents.name: Higashiyama Hanatouro
featuredEvents.description: Annual illumination event with lanterns lighting up historic streets.

featuredEvents.name: Nagashi-bina at Shimogamo Shrine
featuredEvents.description: Traditional doll floating ceremony on Girls' Day.

events.description: Witness Kyoto's most magical time as cherry blossoms bloom across the city, creating stunning pink landscapes in parks, temples, and along the Philosopher's Path.

featuredEvents.name: Maruyama Park Cherry Blossom Viewing
featuredEvents.description: Most popular hanami (cherry blossom viewing) spot in Kyoto.

featuredEvents.name: Daigo-ji Temple Cherry Blossom Festival
featuredEvents.description: Historic cherry blossom festival dating back to 1598.

events.description: One of Kyoto's three major festivals featuring a grand procession in Heian-period costumes from the Imperial Palace to Shimogamo and Kamigamo shrines.

featuredEvents.name: Aoi Matsuri
featuredEvents.description: Historic procession with participants in Heian-period costumes.

featuredEvents.name: Mifune Matsuri
featuredEvents.description: Ancient boat festival with court music and dancing.

events.description: Visit temples like Mimurotoji and Fujinomori Shrine to see beautiful hydrangea gardens in full bloom, creating colorful landscapes across Kyoto.

featuredEvents.name: Hydrangea Viewing at Mimurotoji
featuredEvents.description: Known as the 'Hydrangea Temple' with 10,000 hydrangea plants.

featuredEvents.name: Takigi Noh
featuredEvents.description: Traditional Noh theater performances by firelight.

events.description: Experience Japan's most famous festival with magnificent float processions, traditional music, food stalls, and the city-wide celebrations throughout the month.

featuredEvents.name: Gion Matsuri Yamaboko Junko
featuredEvents.description: Grand processions featuring elaborate festival floats.

featuredEvents.name: Yoiyama Evenings
featuredEvents.description: Evening celebrations with streets closed to traffic, food stalls, and festival atmosphere.

events.description: Watch as huge bonfires in the shape of characters are lit on mountains surrounding Kyoto, marking the end of the Obon festival and guiding ancestors' spirits back to their world.

featuredEvents.name: Daimonji Gozan Okuribi
featuredEvents.description: Five giant bonfires lit on mountains to send off ancestral spirits.

featuredEvents.name: Kyoto Kyo-Yuzen Lantern Festival
featuredEvents.description: Hundreds of hand-painted lanterns floating on the river.

events.description: Join traditional tsukimi (moon viewing) events at temples and gardens across Kyoto, with special nighttime openings and cultural performances.

featuredEvents.name: Tsukimi at Daikakuji Temple
featuredEvents.description: Traditional moon viewing with boats on Osawa Pond.

featuredEvents.name: Kangetsu-no-yube at Kodai-ji
featuredEvents.description: Special night illuminations for moon viewing season.

events.description: Watch this historical pageant featuring a procession of over 2,000 participants dressed in costumes representing different periods of Kyoto's 1,200-year history.

featuredEvents.name: Jidai Matsuri
featuredEvents.location: Kyoto Imperial Palace to Heian Shrine
featuredEvents.description: Historical parade showcasing costumes from different eras of Kyoto's history.

featuredEvents.name: Kurama Fire Festival
featuredEvents.description: One of Japan's most spectacular fire festivals with giant torches.

events.description: Explore Kyoto's temples and gardens transformed by brilliant autumn colors, with special evening illuminations highlighting the red maples against historic backdrops.

featuredEvents.name: Autumn Illuminations at Kiyomizu-dera
featuredEvents.description: Special evening openings with illuminated autumn foliage.

featuredEvents.name: Autumn Leaves at Eikando Temple
featuredEvents.description: Famous spot for vibrant maple foliage viewing.

events.description: Experience the Arashiyama district illuminated by thousands of lanterns, with light installations along the famous bamboo grove and Togetsukyo Bridge.

featuredEvents.name: Arashiyama Hanatoro
featuredEvents.description: Bamboo groves and streets illuminated with thousands of lanterns.

featuredEvents.name: Joya-no-kane
featuredEvents.description: Traditional bell-ringing ceremonies at temples to welcome the New Year.
